1.name: Gaslight
1.description: Years after her aunt was murdered in her home, a young woman moves back into the house with her new husband. However, he has a secret that he will do anything to protect, even if it means driving his wife insane.

2.name: Double Indemnity
2.description: An insurance representative lets himself be talked into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses the suspicion of an insurance investigator.

3.name: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
3.description: In the wake of Pearl Harbor, a young lieutenant leaves his expectant wife to volunteer for a secret bombing mission which will take the war to the Japanese homeland.

4.name: Arsenic and Old Lace
4.description: A drama critic learns on his wedding day that his beloved maiden aunts are homicidal maniacs, and that insanity runs in his family.

5.name: Laura
5.description: A police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.

6.name: To Have and Have Not
6.description: During World War II, American expatriate Harry Morgan helps transport a French Resistance leader and his beautiful wife to Martinique while romancing a sensuous lounge singer.

7.name: Meet Me in St. Louis
7.description: In the year leading up to the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, the four Smith daughters learn lessons of life and love, even as they prepare for a reluctant move to New York.

8.name: Lifeboat
8.description: Several survivors of a torpedoed merchant ship in World War II find themselves in the same lifeboat with one of the U-boat men who sunk it.

9.name: Murder, My Sweet
9.description: After being hired to find an ex-con's former girlfriend, Philip Marlowe is drawn into a deeply complex web of mystery and deceit.

10.name: Captain America
10.description: Superhero Captain America battles the evil forces of the archvillain called The Scarab, who poisons his enemies and steals a secret device capable of destroying buildings by sound vibrations.

11.name: House of Frankenstein
11.description: An evil scientist and his hunchbacked assistant escape from prison and encounter Dracula, the Wolf Man and Frankenstein's Monster.

12.name: Detective Kitty O'Day
12.description: A girl and her boyfriend are suspected of murdering her employer. They have to clear their names and find the real killer.

13.name: National Velvet
13.description: A jaded former jockey helps a young girl prepare a wild but gifted horse for England's Grand National Sweepstakes.

14.name: Phantom Lady
14.description: A devoted secretary risks her life to try to find the elusive woman who may prove her boss didn't murder his selfish wife.

15.name: The Woman in the Window
15.description: When a conservative middle-aged professor engages in a minor dalliance with a femme fatale, he is plunged into a nightmarish quicksand of blackmail and murder.

16.name: The Three Caballeros
16.description: Donald receives his birthday gifts, which include traditional gifts and information about Brazil (hosted by Zé Carioca) and Mexico (by Panchito, a Mexican Charro Rooster).

17.name: The Uninvited
17.description: A composer and his sister discover that the reason they are able to purchase a beautiful gothic seacoast mansion very cheaply is the house's unsavory past.

18.name: Going My Way
18.description: Father Charles O'Mailey, a young priest at a financially failing Church in a tough neighborhood, gains support and inspires his superior.

19.name: Since You Went Away
19.description: With her husband away to fight in World War II, a housewife struggles to care for their two daughters - and a pair of lodgers who have moved in - alone.

20.name: It Happened Tomorrow
20.description: A young turn-of-the-century newspaper man finds he can get hold of the next day's paper. This brings more problems than fortune, especially as his new girlfriend is part of a phony clairvoyant act.

21.name: Henry V
21.description: In the midst of the Hundred Years' War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

22.name: Cover Girl
22.description: Rusty Parker wins a contest and becomes a celebrated cover girl; this endangers her romance with dancing mentor Danny.

23.name: Ivan the Terrible, Part I
23.description: During the early part of his reign, Ivan the Terrible faces betrayal from the aristocracy and even his closest friends as he seeks to unite the Russian people.

24.name: Ministry of Fear
24.description: Stephen Neale has just been released from an asylum during World War 2 in England when he stumbles on a deadly Nazi spy plot by accident, and tries to stop it.

25.name: Address Unknown
25.description: US art dealer returns to his native Germany for a visit and is attracted by Nazi propaganda.

26.name: Charlie Chan in the Secret Service
26.description: Charlie Chan is an agent of the U.S. government assigned to investigate the mysterious death of an inventor.

27.name: The Thin Man Goes Home
27.description: Nick and Nora visit Nick's hometown, and end up involved in a murder.

28.name: This Happy Breed
28.description: Noël Coward's attempt to show how the ordinary people lived between the wars. Just after World War I, the Gibbons family moves to a nice house in the suburbs. An ordinary sort of life is ...                See full summary »

29.name: The Purple Heart
29.description: A stock WW2 era drama which was produced for morale purposes.

30.name: The Fighting Seabees
30.description: During WW2, the U.S. Navy implements a new idea of forming construction battalions that also are fighting units, in case of Japanese attack.

31.name: A Canterbury Tale
31.description: Three modern day pilgrims investigate a bizarre crime in a small town on the way to Canterbury.

32.name: The Big Noise
32.description: During World War II Stan and Ollie find themselves as improbable bodyguards to an eccentric inventor and his strategically important new bomb.

33.name: The Lodger
33.description: A landlady suspects her new lodger is Jack the Ripper.

34.name: Mr. Skeffington
34.description: Popular and beautiful Fanny Trellis is forced into a loveless marriage with an older man, Jewish banker Job Skeffington, in order to save her beloved brother Trippy from an embezzlement charge, and predictable complications result.

35.name: Tall in the Saddle
35.description: Ranch hand Rocklin arrives in town to start his new job but his employer has been murdered and the locals don't seem too friendly.

36.name: The Curse of the Cat People
36.description: The young, friendless daughter of Oliver and Alice Reed befriends her father's dead first wife and an aging, reclusive actress.

37.name: The Keys of the Kingdom
37.description: A young priest, Father Chisholm is sent to China to establish a Catholic parish among the non-Christian Chinese. While his boyhood friend, also a priest, flourishes in his calling as a ...                See full summary »

38.name: None But the Lonely Heart
38.description: When an itinerant reluctantly returns home to help his sickly mother run her shop, they are both tempted to turn to crime to help make ends meet.

39.name: The Suspect
39.description: In 1902 London, unhappily married Philip Marshall meets young Mary Gray, who is unemployed and depressed. Their deepening friendship, though physically innocent, is discovered by Philip's ...                See full summary »

40.name: Between Two Worlds
40.description: Passengers on an ocean liner can't recall how they got on board or where they are going yet, oddly enough, it soon becomes apparent that they all have something in common.

41.name: Casanova Brown
41.description: Cass Brown is about to marry for the second time; his first marriage, to Isabel, was annulled. But when he discovers that Isabel just had their baby, Cass kidnaps the infant to keep her ...                See full summary »

42.name: The Mummy's Curse
42.description: An irrigation project in the rural bayous of Louisiana unearths living mummy Kharis, who was buried in quicksand twenty-five years earlier.

43.name: Dragon Seed
43.description: The lives of a small Chinese village are turned Upside down when the Japanese invade it. And heroic young Chinese woman leads her fellow villagers in an uprising against Japanese Invaders.

44.name: The Seventh Cross
44.description: In Nazi Germany in 1936 seven men escape from a concentration camp. The camp commander puts up seven crosses and, as the Gestapo returns each escapee he is put to death on a cross. The ...                See full summary »

45.name: The Mask of Dimitrios
45.description: Mystery writer Cornelius Leyden becomes intrigued when the murdered body of a vicious career criminal washes up in the Bosphorus.

46.name: The Way Ahead
46.description: World War II drama that follows a group of British draftees, starting with their rigorous basic training, and ending with their deployment in North Africa.

47.name: Days of Glory
47.description: A heroic guerilla group fights back against impossible odds during the 1941 Nazi invasion of Russia.

48.name: I'll Be Seeing You
48.description: A soldier suffering from combat fatigue meets a young woman on Christmas furlough from prison and their mutual loneliness blossoms into romance.

49.name: The Scarlet Claw
49.description: When a gentlewoman is found dead with her throat torn out, the villagers blame a supernatural monster. But Sherlock Holmes, who gets drawn into the case from nearby Quebec, suspects a human murderer.

50.name: Buffalo Bill
50.description: The story of William "Buffalo Bill" Cody, legendary westerner, from his days as an army scout to his later activities as owner of a Wild West show.
